title: OP champs.
body: Just a quick question, Are Vik, Diana and Cho very op? or just have little counter play?

replies.body:
Nah nah viktor sucks don't play him (shhhh)

Anyway, from my experiences, leblanc (50/50, one mistake = lane lost), zed (only if he's good), talon, syndra (I've heard this but never vsed one), cho (QWR you dead). Might be more but I forgot.

Edit: the champs I listed were for the ones that usually beat me when I go viktor*

> [{quoted}](name=Best Viktor AU,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-16T13:49:28.448+0000)

> Nah nah viktor sucks don't play him (shhhh)
> 
> Anyway, from my experiences, leblanc (50/50, one mistake = lane lost), zed (only if he's good), talon, syndra (I've heard this but never vsed one), cho (QWR you dead). Might be more but I forgot.

talon is pretty strong I think I have lost lane twice with talon and only because jg camped
I went 7 straight wins with Talon once and I not once did I ever even bother comboing perfectly on him. I'm no master Talon either... He's really really strong rn lol

> [{quoted}](name=TSM BjergWannabe,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-05-16T20:52:26.546+0000)
>
> I went 7 straight wins with Talon once and I not once did I ever even bother comboing perfectly on him. I'm no master Talon either... He's really really strong rn lol

Pretty sure talon was rated worst assasin atm xD (5.8)

LMAO SRS? What was the criteria? Because I'd probably agree he has one of the worst Assassin kits, he gets in, instakills someone and doesn't get out lmao. The whole point of an Assassin is to get in and get out.

> [{quoted}](name=ShuffledPancake,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-17T00:45:23.205+0000)
>

no he is still pretty strong and with new tbc is so fking strong 6 satcks with 1 combo

> [{quoted}](name=Mar3thyu,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-17T02:37:16.275+0000)
>

he is probably tied with akali then HA

> [{quoted}](name=Best Viktor AU,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-16T13:49:28.448+0000)

>syndra (I've heard this but never vsed one)

Her laning sucks since nerfs but is a power house mid to late game. Especially if she has a great front line on her side.

Viktor has tons of damage, but I wouldn't say his kit is OP. (But of course the master Viktor has already answered your thread. xD

Diana is ridiculously strong right now and Cho is also strong BUT has lots of bad matchups.

I PERSONALLY feel like Annie, Diana, Swain, Sejuani and Riven are the op champs atm.

>Annie

Psst, build a banshee's.

Also riven is only OP if you actually outskill your opponent (in which case you can probably beat them on any champ anyway)

Yeah I guess Banshee's works, it's just you don't always play champions that Banshee's would be good on you know?

I don't know in MY personal opinion, OP are champs who have no counter play or just simply have overloaded kits.

Annie's stun is point and click. If she wants to Tibbers, its AOE with a stun and literally half healths all the squishies on the enemy team, not to mention Tibbers has no missle speed and no cast time.

And Riven has AA empowerment, AA resets, a knockup, an AOE stun, a low cooldown shield/dash THAT SCALES OFF OF HER MAIN STAT (that part never made sense to me), an execute and ridiculously long cooldowns. Like, dat bitch has the most overloaded kit everrrr
In the ADC department, I think Graves has a really strong early game. But I'm not sure if he really is OP.

>Are Vik, Diana and Cho very op?

49.58%, 51.25% and 50.53% win rates aren't OP.

Sej, Heimer, Amumu, Malz and Jinx are the current top 5 win rates and would be closer to what is "OP"
They are only situational OP, which means they're quite balanced.
Right, Would you mind telling me who beats Vik haha?

> [{quoted}](name=IVIemes,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Y9HkQAAq,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-05-16T12:50:48.205+0000)
>
> Right, Would you mind telling me who beats Vik haha?

Viktor is a carry type mage, denying his early does him great inconvenience, which assassins are ideal for the position since they are meant to be aggressive early, also Viktor is not mobile and his Gravity Field has a delay with a long cd.

Tenacity, mobility, strong laning pokes are all effective against him.

So mobile assassins like LB or Zed and a few others shouldn't have problem beating him around all day, which is probably why we don't see Viktor often for the most part.
